edu.exploratorium.rotary
Class RotaryInterface

java.lang.Object
  edu.exploratorium.rotary.RotaryInterface

public class RotaryInterface
extends java.lang.Object

An interface for easily accessing data from one or more rotary encoders, using Ray Gruenig's rotary encoder Arduino program.

To use, create a RotaryInterface instance, and either listen for rotary encoder speed updates via a onRotaryEvent() method, or request the most recent rotary encoder speed directly via getSpeed().

This library supports up to four rotary encoders simultaneously, though the Arduino library currently supports only one. When multiple rotary encoders are supported by the hardware, they can be accessed independently via their channel id, which is passed as a parameter to your onRotaryEvent() method.

The 'feel' of the encoders can be adjusted via the setInputCurve(float), setAccel(float), setInertia(float), and setStopThold(float) methods.

Example: 

        void setup () {
                size(400, 400);
                rotaryInterface = new RotaryInterface(this, true);
        }
 
        void draw () {
                // access speed directly, or create an onRotaryEvent method
                //to receive speed updates as they're available
                float spinSpeed = rotaryInterface.getSpeed();
        }
 
        void onRotaryEvent (float speed, int channel) {
                println("Speed:"+speed+"; channel:"+channel);
        }

Author:
esocolofsky

RotaryInterface

public RotaryInterface(processing.core.PApplet p)
This constructor signature creates a RotaryInterface with default settings. Suitable when using rotary encoder hardware emulating keystrokes, in a Processing IDE project.

Parameters:
p - Reference to the host PApplet.

RotaryInterface

public RotaryInterface(processing.core.PApplet p,
                       boolean serial)
This constructor signature creates a RotaryInterface with the option to specify serial or keyboard emulator rotary encoder hardware.

Parameters:
p - Reference to the host PApplet.
serial - true to specify that the rotary encoder hardware will transmit values via a serial port.

p - Reference to the host PApplet.
serial - true to specify that the rotary encoder hardware will transmit values via a serial port.

Method Detail

getSpeed

public float getSpeed()
Get the calculated speed for the default encoder (encoder on channel 0).

+Example
import processing.serial.*;
import edu.exploratorium.rotary.serial.*;
import edu.exploratorium.rotary.*;

RotaryInterface rotaryInterface;

float y = 0f;

void setup () {
  size(400, 400);
  rotaryInterface = new RotaryInterface(this, true);
  smooth();
  
  frameRate(30);
  background(0);
}

void draw () {
  fill(0, 50);
  rect(0, 0, width, height);
  
  float spinSpeed = rotaryInterface.getSpeed();
  y += height*spinSpeed;
  while (y > height) {
    y -= height;
  }
  while (y < 0) {
    y += height;
  }
  
  noStroke();
  fill(255);
  rect(0, y, width, 50);
}

getInputCurve

public float getInputCurve()
The input curve determines how much more (or less) of an effect encoder hardware speed values have as they approach the max values. A value of 1.0 is a linear translation from hardware values to software values; a value of 2.0 is a strong curve flattening out lower values; a value of 0.5 is a strong curve amplifying lower values. Default is .

setInputCurve

public void setInputCurve(float val)

getStopThold

public float getStopThold()
When speed falls below the stop threshold, the software speed resets to 0. Default is .

setStopThold

public void setStopThold(float val)

getAccel

public float getAccel()
The acceleration determines how quickly the software speed approaches the values reported by the encoder hardware. In effect, this value smoothes out values reported by the encoder hardware. Default is .

setAccel

public void setAccel(float val)

getInertia

public float getInertia()
Inertia determines how quickly the software speed returns to 0. A value of 1.0 will result in a speed that never decelerates; A value of 0.0 will result in speeds that stop immediately after they're first reported by the hardware. Default is .

setInertia

public void setInertia(float val)
